page.title: 01INTRODUCTION-GALSTON
page.content: Galston is a small town with a population of 6,000. It is situated in the upper Irvine valley 7 kilometres from Kilmarnock. At the meeting of the upland and lowland Ayrshire it is a natural routeway and market centre.Its industrial function has varied in form over the years and has been based on textiles and coal-mining. These factors have allowed the town to develop into a more important service centre than the neighbouring towns of Newmilns,Darvel and Hurlford. This is reflected clearly in the amenity index and community services. The surrounding countryside is typical of rural Ayrshire and has for its base Dairy and sheep farming.
